Emerging growth company&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section&nbsp;13(a) of the Exchange Act.&nbsp;&nbsp;&#9744; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Item&nbsp;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. On April&nbsp;1, 2019, Broadcom Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) held its 2019 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. Holders of the Company&#146;s shares of common stock voted on the following matters: &nbsp; (1) To elect 8 members to the Company&#146;s board of directors; &nbsp; (2) To ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending November&nbsp;3, 2019; &nbsp; (3) To approve amendments to the Company&#146;s Second Amended and Restated Employee Share Purchase Plan; &nbsp; (4) Non-binding, advisory vote to approve the compensation of the Company&#146;s named executive officers. For each of these proposals a quorum was present. The votes cast in connection with such matters were as follows: &nbsp; (1) Election of Directors : &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; Name &nbsp;&nbsp; For &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; Against &nbsp;&nbsp; Abstain &nbsp;&nbsp; Broker&nbsp;Non-Votes (a) &nbsp; Hock E. Item&nbsp;8.01 Other Events In a press release issued on March&nbsp;29, 2019, Broadcom Inc. (&#147;Broadcom&#148;) announced that it intends to offer senior notes, subject to market conditions and other factors. The foregoing description is qualified in its entirety by reference to the press release dated March&nbsp;29, 2019, a copy of which is filed as Exhibit 99.1 and incorporated by reference herein. In a press release issued on March&nbsp;29, 2019, Broadcom announced that it priced its previously announced offering of $2,000&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of 3.125% Senior Notes due 2021, $1,500&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of 3.125% Senior Notes due 2022, $2,000&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of 3.625% Senior Notes due 2024, $2,500&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of 4.250% Senior Notes due 2026 and $3,000&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of 4.750% Senior Notes due 2029. Broadcom intends to use the net proceeds from the sale of the notes to repay outstanding indebtedness under its existing credit agreement with Bank of America, N.A., as the administrative agent and the other lenders named therein. The securities are being sold in a private placement to persons reasonably believed to be qualified institutional buyers pursuant to Rule 144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the &#147;Securities Act&#148;), and to non-U.S. persons outside the United States under Regulation S under the Securities Act. The foregoing description is qualified in its entirety by reference to the press release dated March&nbsp;29, 2019, a copy of which is filed as Exhibit 99.2 and incorporated by reference herein. Item&nbsp;9.01 Financial Statements and Exhibits. Announces Private Offering of Senior Notes&#148; 99.2 &nbsp;&nbsp; Press release, dated March&nbsp;29, 2019, entitled &#147;Broadcom Inc. Announces Pricing of Private Offering of Senior Notes&#148; SIGNATURE Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned, hereunto duly authorized. &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; BROADCOM INC.
